data.enText: to burst or pour out suddenly; to produce sudden, powerful streams of liquid or flames
Blood was spurting from her nose.
data.chText: 血从她鼻子里汩汩流出来。

data.enText: Red and yellow flames spurted out of the fire.
data.chText: 炉火吐出红色黄色的火焰。

data.enText: The volcano spurted clouds of steam and ash high into the air.
data.chText: 火山把团团热气和灰尘喷向高空。

data.enText: to increase your speed for a short time to get somewhere faster
She spurted past me to get to the line first.
data.chText: 她冲刺超过我，率先抵达终点线。

data.enText: an amount of liquid or flames that comes out of somewhere with great force
data.chText: 涌出的液体；喷出的火舌

data.enText: a sudden increase in speed, effort, activity or emotion for a short period of time
data.chText: （速度、干劲、活动或感情的）短时激增，迸发

data.enText: You'd better put on a spurt (= hurry up) if you want to finish that work today.
data.chText: 你要是想今天完成那项工作，最好狠加一把劲。

data.enText: Babies get very hungry during growth spurts.
data.chText: 婴儿在猛长期间会很饿。

data.enText: in short periods of great activity, powerful movement, etc., rather than in a steady, continuous way
The water came out of the tap in spurts.
data.chText: 水急速地从水龙头里喷出来。

means: (速度、干劲、活动或感情的)短时激增，迸发

data.enText: in short periods of great activity, powerful movement, etc., rather than in a steady, continuous way
The water came out of the tap in spurts.
data.chText: 水急速地从水龙头里喷出来。

tr: the occurrence of a sudden discharge (as of liquid)
move or act with a sudden increase in speed or energy
gush forth in a sudden stream or jet

example.ex: They spurted blood all over me. I nearly passed out...
example.tran: 他们的血喷了我一身。我几乎昏了过去。

example.ex: He hit her on the head, causing her too to spurt blood.
example.tran: 他击中了她的头部，她也开始流血。

example.ex: ...a fountain that spurts water nine stories high...
example.tran: 水可以喷到 9 层楼那么高的喷泉

example.ex: I saw flames spurt from the roof.
example.tran: 我看到火焰从屋顶冒了出来。

example.ex: When the washing machine spurts out water at least we can mop it up...
example.tran: 洗衣机冒出水来时，我们至少可以把水擦干。

example.ex: Wear eye protection when opening the container, since it's so easy for contents to spurt out.
example.tran: 打开容器时要戴好护眼罩，因为里面的东西很容易喷出来。

value.def: When liquid or fire spurts from somewhere, or when something spurts liquid or fire, it comes out quickly in a thin, powerful stream.

example.ex: A spurt of diesel came from one valve and none from the other.
example.tran: 一股柴油从一个阀门中喷射出来，另一个阀门中则没有喷出任何东西。

value.def: A spurt of liquid is a stream of it which comes out of something very forcefully.

example.ex: At adolescence, muscles go through a growth spurt...
example.tran: 在青春期，肌肉会迅猛发育。

example.ex: I flushed bright red as a spurt of anger flashed through me...
example.tran: 一股怒气直冲头顶，我的脸一下子涨得通红。

example.ex: The recent spurt in violence has demoralised the public.
example.tran: 最近暴力行为激增，这已经打击了公众的信心。

value.def: A spurt of activity, effort, or emotion is a sudden, brief period of intense activity, effort, or emotion.

example.ex: The back wheels spun and the van spurted up the last few feet.
example.tran: 后轮突然转动起来，货车加速冲过了最后几英尺距离。

example.ex: These muscles work in a steady state for most of the race except at the end when the athlete puts on a spurt.
example.tran: 在赛跑过程中这些肌肉多数时间里都匀速地运动着，但在最后运动员冲刺时则是例外。

value.def: If someone or something spurts somewhere, they suddenly increase their speed for a short while in order to get there.

example.ex: The deals came in spurts: three in 1977, none in 1978, three more in 1979.
example.tran: 交易时有时无：1977 年有 3 笔，1978 年没有，1979 年又有 3 笔。

value.def: If something happens in spurts, there are periods of activity followed by periods in which it does not happen.
